meanings.definition: A fact or piece of data from a study of a large quantity of numerical data.
examples: Scientists often use statistics to guide decisions about whether or not to accept a hypothesis.

meanings.definition: The sex of a person or animal.
examples: It doesn't matter what your gender is, many people like swimming.

images.alt: Screen capture of gender choice in a questionnaire.
images.description: Screen capture of gender choice in a questionnaire. Choices include Female, Male, and Transgender.
images.caption: Survey with choices for identifying gender.

examples: The trend toward obesity continues in many modern countries.

meanings.definition: Something that happens; a single event.
examples: Several incidents of money disappearing led them to believe that someone was stealing from them.

meanings.definition: Someone who is hurt, injured, or killed by a person, group, or event.
examples: They were victims of unfair treatment by others.

images.alt: Photo of fist in the foreground and person sitting on the ground.
images.description: A person stands with a clenched fist in the foreground. A person sits with head down and hands over head in the background.
images.caption: Victims can be hurt physically, through words, or other actions.

source.title: Man in Yellow Shirt and Blue Denim Jeans
source.author: Karolina Grabowska
